Operation 'findEligibleItems' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_input_details, missing_output_details. Original summary was empty. Description lacked clarity on: (1) authentication requirement, (2) return type and structure (PagedEligibleItemCollection), (3) pagination support, (4) specific input parameters needed. Improved version specifies what the operation returns, how to use results, and includes domain terminology consistent with API schemas (PagedEligibleItemCollection, EligibleItem). This helps AI agents understand when to call this operation and how to process results.

data.current_description:
This method evaluates a seller's current listings and returns the set of IDs that are eligible for a seller-initiated discount offer to a buyer.

A listing ID is returned only when one or more buyers have shown an "interest" in the listing.

If any buyers have shown interest in a listing, the seller can initiate a "negotiation" with them by calling sendOfferToInterestedBuyers, which sends all interested buyers a message that offers the listing at a discount.

For details about how to create seller offers to buyers, see Sending offers to buyers.
data.summary_suggestion: Retrieve listings eligible for buyer discount offers
data.description_suggestion: Evaluates the authenticated seller's current listings and returns a paginated collection of listing IDs that are eligible for seller-initiated discount offers. A listing is eligible only when one or more buyers have shown interest (e.g., added to watch list or abandoned cart). Returns a PagedEligibleItemCollection containing eligible item IDs and pagination details. Use the returned listing IDs with sendOfferToInterestedBuyers to send discount offers to interested buyers.
data.reasoning: Original summary was empty. Description lacked clarity on: (1) authentication requirement, (2) return type and structure (PagedEligibleItemCollection), (3) pagination support, (4) specific input parameters needed. Improved version specifies what the operation returns, how to use results, and includes domain terminology consistent with API schemas (PagedEligibleItemCollection, EligibleItem). This helps AI agents understand when to call this operation and how to process results.

message: Operation 'sendOfferToInterestedBuyers' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_input_details, missing_output_details, missing_side_effects. Original summary was empty. Description was verbose and lacked specificity on: (1) required input structure (CreateOffersRequest schema), (2) response format (SendOfferToInterestedBuyersCollectionResponse), (3) side effects of sending offers, (4) discount options (percentage vs. fixed price). Improved version uses domain terminology from API schemas, clarifies inputs/outputs, and explains state changes. This enables AI agents to understand what data to prepare and what to expect in response.

data.current_description:
This method sends eligible buyers offers to purchase items in a listing at a discount.

When a buyer has shown interest in a listing, they become "eligible" to receive a seller-initiated offer to purchase the item(s).

Sellers use findEligibleItems to get the set of listings that have interested buyers. If a listing has interested buyers, sellers can use this method (sendOfferToInterestedBuyers) to send an offer to the buyers who are interested in the listing. The offer gives buyers the ability to purchase the associated listings at a discounted price.

For details about how to create seller offers to buyers, see Sending offers to buyers.
data.summary_suggestion: Send discount offers to interested buyers
data.description_suggestion: Sends seller-initiated discount offers to buyers who have shown interest in one or more listings. Accepts a CreateOffersRequest containing offer details (listing IDs, discount amount or percentage, expiration date, and buyer messaging). All interested buyers for the specified listings receive the offer notification. Returns a SendOfferToInterestedBuyersCollectionResponse with offer creation status. Side effects: Creates offer records, notifies eligible buyers, and may impact listing visibility and buyer engagement metrics.
data.reasoning: Original summary was empty. This enables AI agents to understand what data to prepare and what to expect in response.
